name: NPR
text:
President Trump says he will create a commission to promote "patriotic education" as well as a grant to develop a "pro-American curriculum."

The federal government does not have jurisdiction over school curriculum.
https://t.co/VGwI2TY0V1

name: NPR
text: Today on #NPRConsiderthis, campaigns and political parties have staffed up their legal war rooms, making this campaign season one of the most litigated ever.  We look at the lawsuits already filed and what might come next. https://t.co/tu29AyYbGL

name: NPR
text:
The postmaster general, in a "tense" call with top U.S. election officials, said his agency is equipped to handle the expected increase in mail volume during this election season.
https://t.co/zLwIC5p1U7

name: NPR
text:
President Trump on Thursday decried what he said was a "twisted web of lies" being taught in U.S. classrooms about systemic racism in America — and called it "a form of child abuse."
https://t.co/MfWzpyJm30

name: NPR
text:
The Scientific American has endorsed Joe Biden — the magazine's first-ever presidential endorsement in its 175-year history.

"We need to tell what we know about the consequences the Trump administration has had for science," its editor-in-chief says.
https://t.co/LYMZtCDZrZ

name: NPR
text:
Educators around the U.S. are facing heartbreaking choices between the needs of their students and the needs of their own children.

"I have never worked harder in my life, the level of mental fatigue is tremendous."
https://t.co/v8m39qrjlE

name: NPR
text:
Nearly 30 Massachusetts high school students have been told to quarantine after one student's parents sent their teenager to school despite knowing they tested positive for the coronavirus.
https://t.co/aBap0EzwDf

name: NPR
text:
The WHO says weekly coronavirus cases in Europe are rising at a higher rate than during the pandemic's peak in March, with "alarming rates of transmission across the region."
https://t.co/wScLGOEcF3

name: NPR
text:
RT @MorningEdition: Breonna Taylor's name has become a rallying cry in protests against racial injustice.

While the police who killed Taylor in March have not been charged, her family received a settlement this week in a wrongful death lawsuit.

Her mother Tamika Palmer talks to @rachelnpr: https://t.co/ffnxKdrrXPBreonna Taylor's name has become a rallying cry in protests against racial injustice.

While the police who killed… https://t.co/Lk9wvSEQfu

name: NPR
text:
President Trump and Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden are both traveling to Minnesota today, as the contested state begins its early voting period.
https://t.co/JuWQDj2PVN

name: NPR
text:
A new NPR poll shows households of color have been hardest hit financially by COVID-19.

Percentages of households that report facing "serious financial problems" during the pandemic:
-Latino: 72%
-Black: 60%
-Native American: 55%
-Asian: 37%
-White: 36%
https://t.co/2KUr3Q9ZcU
